facts.1: Statehood Day commemorates the day in 1878 when the Berlin Congress recognized Montenegro as the twenty-seventh independent state in the world.
facts.2: This holiday also coincides with the day in 1941 when Montenegrins staged an uprising against the fascist occupiers.
facts.3: The Statehood Day celebration is a two-day event starting on July 13th and is often marked with official ceremonies and cultural events.

facts.1: Embrace Your Geekness Day is an informal holiday that encourages people to be proud of their geeky interests and hobbies.
facts.2: Common activities on this day include playing video games, reading comic books, and engaging in various technological endeavors.
facts.3: The holiday highlights the impact of geek culture on modern society and promotes the acceptance of diverse passions.

facts.1: National French Fry Day celebrates one of America's favorite fast-food items: the French fry.
facts.2: Various restaurants across the United States participate by offering free or discounted French fries.
facts.3: French fries come in many shapes and sizes, including curly fries, waffle fries, and the classic shoestring fries.
